channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023080298
item.description:
Report X-2023080298

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload where it was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to the QA hut to be processed. DescribePack: One of the paints can had a loose lid on top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat bag was placed into a white pail and placed into the hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080301
item.description:
Report X-2023080301

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded which was then noticed as soiled. The package was placed in the Hazmat cage in a red hazardous tote and hazardous tote bag. DescribePack: The damage to the bottle indicates it was dropped because the base of the neck has some dented plastic. DurationRel: 38 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bag and tote in the hazmat cage to be inspected. package was placed in upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023080288
item.description:
Report X-2023080288

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I had went to the hut and randomly, I saw a hazmat that was destroyed and needed to be processed right away. DescribePack: 2 bottles out of 4 had a missing cap which caused the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I had placed a hazmat bag into the yellow drum and placed it into the hazmat cage awaiting the disposition.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 60 pound pail of accutab si (un2880)had been damaged and had released 25 pounds of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080255
item.description:
Report X-2023080255

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THIS PACKAGE STARTED LEAKING, I WAS CALLED TO THE AREA I TOLD THE PACKAGE HANDLERS TO STOP WORKING IN THE AREA UNTILL, I CLEANED IT UP. DescribePack: ALL CANS WERE DENTED I FOUND PUNCTURE HOLS OM THE SIDE OF THE CAN ABOUT THE SIZE OF A PEN HEAD DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I CLEAND UP WHAT LEAKED OUT I PLACED THE DAMAGED CANS IN A TOTE TO PREVENT ANY OTHER PACKAGES FROM BEING CONTAMINATED.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered loaded onto other boxes halfway into the trailer, stacked upside down near the top of the trailer. DescribePack: Seal on one bottle was not completely sealed. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: immediate removal of the box to QA area

item.title: Report X-2023080216
item.description:
Report X-2023080216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet during loading process, was put into a lined hazmat tote and taken to our hazmat cage and put under the exhaust vent. DescribePack: The caps on the inner containers were loose causing the inner containers to leak and damage package. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed with orientation arrows pointing up and put into lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080192
item.description:
Report X-2023080192

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: YUMA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded when package handler notice a wet spot on package. Package was placed in a hazmat tote to prevent damage/injury. DescribePack: Gallon had loose caps. No clips/tape was used to secure the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately place in a hazmat tote in the upright position to prevent further leakage.

Report X-2023070571

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER WAS UNLOADING A TRAILER WHEN HE WENT TO UNLOAD A BUCKET. THE BUCKET HAD RESIDUE ON THE LID AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR WHO NOTIFIED THE RESPONDERS. TWILIGHT RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE AND UTILIZED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED CHAIN OF COMMAND.

item.title: Report X-2023070554
item.description:
Report X-2023070554

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DOOR FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE CALL. WEARING PPE AND UTILIZING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER OBSERVED A PACKAGE THAT HAD A SMALL STAIN AND HAD A SMELL COMING FROM IT. THE INNER CONTAINERS WERE LEAKING. THE INNER CONTAINERS WERE IN A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE PACKAGE WITHOUT INCIDENT.
